etymologies: Middle English: from Old French preiere, based on Latin precarius ‘obtained by entreaty’, from prex, prec- ‘prayer’

definitions: a solemn request for help or expression of thanks addressed to God or an object of worship

examples.text: I'll say a prayer for him
a commitment to a life of holiness through prayer and Bible-reading

shortDefinitions: solemn request for help or expression of thanks addressed to God or another deity

definitions: a religious service, especially a regular one, at which people gather in order to pray together

examples.text: 500 people were detained as they attended Friday prayers

shortDefinitions: religious service at which people gather

examples.text: it is our prayer that the current progress on human rights will be sustained
